dlr.decision: Sequenced three-patch resolution: (1) disable Cache in restricted regions, (2) remove stat variations, (3) publish player communication

alternatives_rejected.option: Keep Cache globally with probability disclosure only
alternatives_rejected.rejection_reason: Does not resolve Belgium/Netherlands prohibition — regulatory risk unacceptable

alternatives_rejected.option: Remove Cache entirely from all regions
alternatives_rejected.rejection_reason: Creates different CRE drift — promotional content promised to players not delivered; overreaction damages credibility

rs.primary_reasoning: Three-way contradiction loop requires sequenced resolution: regulatory urgency first (Belgium exposure window), then commercial fix (stat variations), then narrative repair (player communication)
counter_claims: Revenue team argued Cache should be retained in unrestricted regions (accepted — region-lock approach)
PR team argued immediate full removal would signal panic to players (accepted — sequenced approach preferred)
Singapore live-ops argued the stat variations were negligible (rejected — 'no competitive content behind random purchases' is a binary commitment)

loop: MON-001 ('monetization matches commitments') contradicts CRE-002 ('franchise narrative integrity') via Player-First Promise blog
CRE-002 depends on REG-002 ('regional monetization restrictions') because the blog implicitly promises legal compliance
REG-002 feeds back to MON-001 because regional restrictions define what 'valid monetization' means

new_edges: Singapore monetization approval → Bucharest compliance pre-check (mandatory)
Singapore monetization approval → Montréal PR consistency review (mandatory)
Public commitment registry → monetization feature approval gate
